intro: Oreopanax ischnolobus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oreopanax, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces berries that contain the seeds. Oreopanax ischnolobus is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and understory habitats.
